ca.ualberta.backend
Class LocalTaskManager

java.lang.Object
  ca.ualberta.backend.LocalTaskManager

public class LocalTaskManager
extends java.lang.Object

The purpose of this class is to enable the saving, loading, and deleting of tasks on the local storage. The only issue is that the caller has to supply the context, which is used to find the absolute directory path to where the application can write. If the context wasn't supplied, the methods below would try to write to the root directory, which is read-only and would throw exceptions. I chose to hide the constructor and make the methods static because this class consists only of helper methods; it wouldn't make sense to instantiate a LocalTaskManager object.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mircea Gabriel Caciula
